name: Lost for Words! 19 Quiz | Lyrics Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text:
"And anytime you feel the pain
Hey ______ refrain
Don't carry the world upon your shoulders"
We're looking for a name on this one.
questions.explanation:
Jude.

	"Hey Jude", written by John Lennon and Paul McCartney, was a hit for the Beatles in 1968.The song was a chart topper in both the US and UK."Hey Jude" was originally called "Hey Jules" and dedicated to John's son Julian who was having a tough time dealing with his parents' divorce.

questions.text:
"______ love is for the very young
Every star's a wishing star that shines for you
______ love is all the seven wonders
One little kiss can tell you this is true"
When is the best time for love?
questions.explanation:
April.

	Pat Boone hit the charts with "April Love" in 1957.The song, written by Paul Francis Webster and Sammy Fain, featured in the movie "April Love" starring Pat Boone and Shirley Jones.

questions.text:
"______ man, there's no need to feel down 
I said, ______ man, pick yourself off the ground 
I said, ______ man, 'cause you're in a new town 
There's no need to be unhappy" 
What type of man is the subject of this song?
questions.explanation:
young.

	Lyrics from the ever popular "Y.M.C.A." by The Village People.A UK chart topper, "Y.M.C.A." also sold a million copies for this US group.The characters in this camp disco outfit included; a cowboy, policeman, biker, soldier, and construction worker his with hard hat.

questions.text:
"If you want my body and you think I'm ______ 
Come on sugar let me know 
If you really need me just reach out and touch me 
Come on honey tell me so"
Which of these words does the singer use to describe himself?
questions.explanation:
sexy.

	"Da Ya Think I'm Sexy" was a chart topper in both the US and UK for Rod Stewart.This 1978 hit was written by Rod Stewart and Carmine Appice.Rod was at one time an apprentice with the Brentford Football Club, in the UK.

questions.text:
"But don't forget who's taking you home and in whose arms you're gonna be 
So darlin', save the last ______ for me"
So what is the singer after?
questions.explanation:
dance.

	The Drifters charted with these lyrics from "Save The Last Dance For Me" in 1960.The single hit the top in the US, peaking at #2 in the UK.The Drifters, founded by Clyd McPhatter in 1953, were inducted into the "Rock and Roll Hall of Fame" in 1988.

questions.text:
"You were working as a ______ in a cocktail bar 
When I met you 
I picked you out, I shook you up, and turned you around"
What was the occupation of the recipient of these lyrics?
questions.explanation:
waitress.

	These lyrics come from the Human League single "Don't You Want Me".This US and UK chart topper featured on the album "Dare".The Human League was one of the first bands to exploit the synthesizer and electro rhythm boom of the 1980s.

questions.text:
"______ between two lovers, feelin' like a fool
Lovin' both of you is breakin' all the rules"
What word completes this Mary MacGregor song lyric?
questions.explanation:
torn.

	"Torn Between Two Lovers" was a 1976/7 hit for Mary MacGregor.The song topped the US charts and reaching #3 in the UK."Torn Between Two Lovers" was Mary MacGregor's debut single.

questions.text:
"I can make you mine, taste your lips of wine 
Anytime night or day 
Only ______ is, gee whiz 
I'm dreamin' my life away"
What word is missing from this popular song?
questions.explanation:
trouble.

	These lines come from the Everly Brothers classic "All I Have To Do Is Dream".This 1958 track by the brothers, Phil and Don, from Kentucky was a US and UK chart topper.Noted for their vocal harmonies the Everly Brothers had a considerable influence on early pop music.

questions.text:
"Well, since my baby left me 
Well, I found a new place to dwell 
Well, it's down at the end of Lonely Street 
At ______ Hotel"
How is this hotel described by Elvis?
questions.explanation:
Heartbreak.

	"Heartbreak Hotel" was written by Mae Axton, Tommy Durden and Elvis Presley.This 1956 single was a US #1 for Elvis, peaking at #2 in the UK.With his fusion of blues, country and rock Elvis created the blueprint for much of the music that was to follow.

questions.text:
"Bah-bah-bah-bah, bah-bah-bah-bah, at the ______!
Well, you can rock it you can roll it
You can stop and you can stroll it at the ______"
So where can we rock 'n and roll it?
questions.explanation:
hop.

	Lyrics from the 1957/8 Danny and The Juniors hit "At the Hop" written by Arthur Singer, John L. Medora, and David White."At the Hop" was a US chart topper, reaching #3 in the UK.
